title: cool ornaments & flourishes ??
content:
I’m looking for a cool set of ornaments/flourishes to use for t-shirt design. I’ve found some cool sets from youworkforthem.com. (see: [http://www.youworkforthem.com/list.php?cat=73](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/list.php?cat=73 "http://www.youworkforthem.com/list.php?cat=73"))

Any other suggestions where I might find more like these?

Thanks!

 [‹ Neutra use examples](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21343 "Go to previous forum topic") [Illusions Masthead ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21091 "Go to next forum topic")
author: se7en

comments.content:
If you like high quality vector color ornaments have a look to the aridi collection. [http://www.aridi.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.aridi.com/ "http://www.aridi.com")

If you like ornament fonts try [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ornaments](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ornaments "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=ornaments")

— [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.astype.de/)—

Underware’s Sauna has some cool dingbats  
 [http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=sauna&id2=detailsdingbats](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=sauna&id2=detailsdingbats "http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=sauna&id2=detailsdingbats")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/26dingbats_3597.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/dingbat-four-layers_5947.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ding-solo_6106.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/how-to-construct_6638.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014731im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/overview-multilayer_5108.gif)

I hate to be a downer, but you will need to read the EULA of any dingbat/image font very closely before you use it for t-shirt designs. Many foundaries do not allow their dingbat/image fonts to be used as a sole element in a design such a t-shirt of logo.

I once had a designer use a glyph, capital D, from one of my fonts, as a corporate logo.  
I was fine with that, but pointed out that the client wouldn’t be able to copyright or trademark their own logo. The same holds true for ornaments/dinbats, I would imagine.
